If you haven‚Äôt already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.36-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/72715 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sjdoinjsidojsoisjd@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Admin invites member to two workspaces. - Member has created an expense in both workspace chats. - Perform the steps below as admin: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to Reports > Reports. 3. Select both expenses from member via checkbox. 4. body:
If you haven‚Äôt already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.35-4 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @coleaeason **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): #Convert ## Action Performed: ##Description: Expensify employees frequently switch between New Expensify (ND) and Classic (OD) as part of daily testing and support workflows. However, every time they click "Switch to Classic", they are forced to complete the feedback survey before being redirected. This creates unnecessary friction and slows down productivity. ##Request: Remove the "Switch to Classic" survey prompt entirely for any user with an @expensify.com email domain so switching platforms can be completed in one click. ## Expected Result: Users with @expensify.com email addresses should be redirected to Classic immediately‚Äîno survey shown. Flow should be one-click and frictionless. ## Actual Result: Every switch to Classic requires filling in a feedback survey. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop
Platforms Tested: On which of our officially supported platforms was this issue tested: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

title: [$50] Update Constant for View payment history

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

body:
If you click View payment history in users accounts, it does always show you all your Expensify charges because the constant is to search for "Expensify, Inc." but at some point we were setting the merchant to "Expensify". So we need to update the search constant to just look for "Expensify" so it will show both versions.

body:
If you haven‚Äôt already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.35-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @danielrvidal **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Convert](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07HPDRELLD/p1760399942009119) ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: User1 and User2 are be on the same workspace 1. User2 sets up User1 as their copilot 2. User1 (via copilot access) comments on a report thread shared with User2 3. User2 mentions @User1 in the same thread 4. A system message appears stating User1 is not in the thread ## Expected Result: If a user has already commented in the thread‚Äîeither directly or via copilot‚Äîthey should be treated as part of the thread. No whisper message from Concierge should be shown when they are @mentioned. ## Actual Result: Whisper message from concierge displayed as User 1 isn't a member of this room ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop
